questionListItems.title:
Will I be placed in the same class in Level 3 as my friends, if we are allocated the same
subject combination?

answer.body: You may or may not be placed in the same class as your friends in Level 3.

questionListItems.title: When will I know which Level 3 class I will be assigned to?

answer.body:
Students will be informed of their Level 3 class via SLS (All Ears) by the end of Dec. Please do not refer to the information in the Parents Gateway app as it may not be updated.

All results will also be placed on the notice board outside the HOD room by the end of Dec

questionListItems.title: Should I choose to do an 8-subject or 9-subject combination?

answer.body:
Students are advised to take into consideration their total curriculum workload in Level 3.
This includes their commitment and workload in external academic (e.g. third language) and
non-academic areas (e.g. CCA, SLB).
All IP students must do a minimum of 8 subjects.

questionListItems.title: I want to do a double science combination. Should I offer Biology or Physics?

answer.body:
Please choose based on your interest and aptitude, and not based solely on your
performance at the End-of-Year Examinations. If you do not have any preference, please
choose Physics, as the subject opens doors to engineering courses in the polytechnics and
universities.

questionListItems.title: How many students in CHS offer Triple Science?

answer.body:
As subject allocation is by merit, the number differs from year to year. In addition, there are
students who qualified but chose not to offer Triple Science for various reasons.

questionListItems.title: How many students in CHS offer Biology / Chemistry?

answer.body:
Most students are doing Chemistry / Physics. The number of students who are doing Biology
/ Chemistry is less than a class on average.

questionListItems.title: I am on MEP / AEP, what subject is compulsory to offer?

answer.body:
Students who are on the MEP / AEP must indicate Higher Music / Higher Art as their second
Humanities subject. In other words, these students will need to take 2 Humanities subjects.

questionListItems.title: If I do not offer Biology / Physics in CHS, will I be able to do the subject at JC?

answer.body:
Students who do not offer Biology / Physics typically will not be allowed to do the subject at
the H2 level in most JCs. Students should always refer to the respective JC websites for more
information on their available subject combinations.

questionListItems.title: What is “H1, H2 and H3” in Junior Colleges?

answer.body: It refers to subjects offered at 3 different levels.

questionListItems.title: I did not attend the selection test for Music, can I appeal to offer this subject?

answer.body:
Students who missed any selection test for subjects e.g. Art, Music, ESS, will not be allowed
to appeal. The responsibility is on the students to take note of the dates and times of these
selection tests.

questionListItems.title: Can I choose to offer Music and Art?

answer.body:
No, all students must opt to offer at least one subject from the Humanities category (e.g.
English Literature, Chinese Literature, History, Geography).

questionListItems.title: Can I choose to offer Geography and Humanities (SS, Geography)?

answer.body:
Students are not allowed to opt for the same subject (e.g. Geography and Humanities (SS,
Geography) or History and Humanities (SS, History) or English Literature and Humanities
(SS, English Literature)) within the same option.

questionListItems.title:
I am currently offering third language at MOE Language Centre (Bishan). Can I choose to do
a 9-subject combination in school, in addition to third language?

answer.body:
Students can opt to do a 9-subject combination in school in Secondary 3. However, in
Secondary 4, approval from MOE will be required in order for students to offer 10 subjects at
a single GCE O-Level sitting

questionListItems.title: What are the requirements for taking subjects with Coursework such as Art, ESS and Music?

answer.body:
The Coursework examination for each subject requires students to work on a long-term
project which spans a few months in the examination year. It requires students to have good
time management skills and diligence.

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for a transfer to the IP track?

answer.body: You will apply via go.gov.sg/chsopip. The deadline for application is 20 October 2023 (Term 4 Week 6). You may direct your queries to HOD / Integrated Programme, Ms Ho Seok Lay (ho_seok_lay@moe.edu.sg).
